Women having sex before marriage. It is very normal now, but for thousands of years in the past it was a taboo. In most antient high cultures and in Europe and many other developed countries up to the middle of the 20th century women were not allowed to have sex before marriage. And any woman who broke this strict rule had a choice to either try to hide this fact from everyone, even her closest friends and family, to ensure nobody ever found that out or (expecially if the premarital sex produced a child and there was no way to hide it anymore) to face open condemnation and even exclusion from their family and community, such a woman could never hope to marry within her social group and was treated very poorly even by her family her whole life. The actual practical reason for this stance in society was that property could only belong to men and passed exclusively through the male line, and forbidding women to have sex with anyone but their husbands was the only way people knew to ensure that any children they produced would be undoubtedly their husbands’ and could inherit their property. Men having sex before marriage also wasn’t viewed favourably, but most men, especially those with high social standing, had sex before marriage and the society didn’t openly condemn it as it was the case with women guilty of the same sin. Men could have premarital sex with prostitutes as well as their slaves and servants (who came from lower social classes and were in a very dependant position either being serfs in the middle ages who had to obey their masters whatever they demanded or needing a job to feed themselves and their family so badly they had to put up with anything). Many of those sex encounters would be called rape today, but for many centuries powerful men could rape any woman from a lower social class and never had to suffer any consequences for this crime. Now you understand where the Women’s Rights’ Movement is coming from.
